intro: Sophora wightii subsp. bhutanica, commonly known as the Bhutanese Sophora, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan regions of Bhutan and northeastern India. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate forests and is often found at elevations between 1,500 and 3,000 meters. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and are an important food source for various wildlife species in its native habitat.
